intro: Wigandia californica, commonly known as the California wigandia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Wigandia californica is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
